commits.summary: Change to a more appropriate resize cursor.
commits.message:
Change to a more appropriate resize cursor.

Previous didn't work properly on Mac (and non-Opera browser's too probably).

commits.summary: If there is just one repository, always use it as defaultRepository
commits.message:
If there is just one repository, always use it as defaultRepository

Beyond making "branches" and filter part of "home" pages more convenient to
use for newly setup single repository Critic instances, this also makes
behavior consistent with what "Config" displays for such an instance.
Although the user had no preference recorded for a newly installed
instance, the "Config" page was populating the defaultRepository dropdown
with a single item representing the only existing repository so for the
user it looked like they had the "Config" properly setup. Just hitting
"Save" without changing anything did indeed set the only repository as
defaultRepository, but such a click should not be necessary ofc.

commits.summary: [fixup] Improve handling of delayed mail delivery
commits.message:
fixup! Avoid generating emails about failure to deliver emails

Improve handling of delayed mail delivery

If a mail is delivered more than 60 seconds after it was put in the
outbox, a warning is logged.  (Historically, such delays have been a
symptom of the "sender" failing to wake up the mail delivery process
after placing mail in the outbox; so the warning has been meaningful.)

However, delayed delivery also happens when the mail server stops
accepting connections or mails for a while.  Sending one mail to the
system administrator(s) per warning (and thus per delayed mail) isn't
very helpful.  Instead, log a single warning indicating that some
mail were delayed, including the total number of delayed mails, how
long the most delayed mail was delayed, and what mail that was.  This
should be enough information to figure out what's wrong (if anything.)

commits.summary: Avoid generating emails about failure to deliver emails
commits.message:
Avoid generating emails about failure to deliver emails

By default, all warnings or errors logged by a background service is
delivered by email to the system administrator(s).  This included errors
logged by the mail delivery service.  But errors logged by it are
typically about inability to deliver email in the first place, so it
makes little sense to send further emails about it.

What's worse, attempting to send emails about mail delivery problems can
lead to exponential amounts of emails being generated as long as mail
delivery is broken.

With these changes, a single email is sent to the system administrator(s)
after an (unrelated) email has been successfully delivered, if any errors
or warnings have been logged, urging the system administrator(s) to check
the logs.  This email is also delivered directly rather than going
through the normal outbox mechanism, thus avoiding treating this as any
other email that in turn can trigger normal error handling.

fixup! Drop unused function (another definition a few lines below)
